metadata.title: USN-6841-1 -- PHP vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that PHP could early return in the filter_var function resulting in invalid user information being treated as valid user information. An attacker could possibly use this issue to expose raw user input information.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6841-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libapache2-mod-php8.2 - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 libphp8.2-embed - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2 - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-bcmath - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-bz2 - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-cgi - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-cli - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-common - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-curl - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-dba - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-dev - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-enchant - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-fpm - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-gd - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-gmp - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-imap - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-interbase - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-intl - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-ldap - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-mbstring - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-mysql - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-odbc - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-opcache - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-pgsql - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-phpdbg - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-pspell - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-readline - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-snmp - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-soap - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-sqlite3 - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-sybase - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-tidy - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-xml - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-xsl - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 php8.2-zip - 8.2.10-2ubuntu2.2 No subscription required
